Yet another overdue... hotfix. Sorry this took so long.

## What's changed
* üëæ The false positive for indented function parameters in namespaces was eradicated. (https://github.com/cpplint/cpplint/pull/304)
  * There is another known false positive for member initializer lists, whose fix will arrive soon! Hopefully.
* üõ∞Ô∏è The project was modernized with a migration to pyproject.toml, pre-commit, ruff, and other tooling courtesy of @cclauss, who has returned as a maintainer! This includes updating the code to conform with several newly-introduced linter checks.
* ‚Ü™Ô∏è Files that end in ".c", ".C", or ".cu" will now also automatically suppress C++-only lint categories. Previously, `// NO_LINT_C` was required. (https://github.com/cpplint/cpplint/pull/318)
* üßë build/include-what-you-use now recognizes c-style headers such as <stdio.h> for symbols from \<cstdio>. (https://github.com/cpplint/cpplint/pull/319)
* üìú @Hs293Go fixed an embarrassing typo in the list of recognized C++ headers. (https://github.com/cpplint/cpplint/pull/300)

For a full changelog, including the plethora of automation and refactoring work by @cclauss, see https://github.com/cpplint/cpplint/compare/2.0.0...2.0.1.

## New Contributors
* @Hs293Go made their first contribution in https://github.com/cpplint/cpplint/pull/300

A large, long-overdue modernization of the codebase!

## What's Changed
* ü©∏Python 2 and 3.7 are no longer supported. Python 3.12 support was added along with fixed CI for 3.8, courtesy of @jayvdb
   * As a result of all this, setup.py's lint subcommand was removed. Please run the commands directly instead.
* üßπ Lots of refactoring , bug fixes, and updates to be more in line with latest C++ and Google style standards.

See [CHANGELOG.rst](https://github.com/cpplint/cpplint/blob/2.0.0/CHANGELOG.rst) for a full changelog, including quite a bit of features not mentioned here.
